truth: -  "The Black Death, a devastating pandemic, swept through Europe in the 14th century, killing an estimated 25 million people."
fiction: -  "The Black Death, a devastating pandemic, swept through Europe in the 14th century, turning an estimated 25 million people into zombies."

truth: -  "The Magna Carta, a significant legal document, was signed by King John of England in 1215."
fiction: -  "The Magna Carta, a significant legal document, was signed by King Arthur of Camelot in 1215."

truth: -  "The Crusades were a series of religious wars initiated by the Latin Church in the medieval period."
fiction: -  "The Crusades were a series of culinary competitions initiated by the Latin Church in the medieval period."

truth: -  "The Hundred Years' War was a long conflict between England and France during the 14th and 15th centuries."
fiction: -  "The Hundred Years' War was a long conflict between England and Narnia during the 14th and 15th centuries."

truth: -  "Feudalism was a hierarchical system of land use and patronage that dominated Medieval Europe."
fiction: -  "Feudalism was a hierarchical system of pizza distribution and patronage that dominated Medieval Europe."

truth: -  "The Knights Templar was a medieval Catholic military order recognized in 1139 by the papal bull Omne Datum Optimum."
fiction: -  "The Knights Templar was a medieval Catholic rock band recognized in 1139 by the papal bull Omne Datum Optimum."

truth: -  "The Battle of Hastings in 1066 marked the beginning of the Norman conquest of England."
fiction: -  "The Battle of Hastings in 1066 marked the beginning of the Martian conquest of England."

truth: -  "The Inquisition was a group of institutions within the Catholic Church tasked with combating heresy during the Middle Ages."
fiction: -  "The Inquisition was a group of institutions within the Catholic Church tasked with combating werewolves during the Middle Ages."

truth: -  "The Viking Age in European history was from the late 8th to early 11th century."
fiction: -  "The Viking Age in European history was from the late 8th to early 11th century, marked by the discovery of lightsabers."

truth: -  "The Gothic style of architecture, characterized by pointed arches and ribbed vaults, originated in Medieval Europe."
fiction: -  "The Gothic style of architecture, characterized by pointed arches and ribbed vaults, originated in Middle-earth."

truth: -  "Charlemagne, also known as Charles the Great, was King of the Franks and Lombards in the 8th century."
fiction: -  "Charlemagne, also known as Charles the Great, was King of the Hobbits and Elves in the 8th century."

truth: -  "The Great Schism of 1054 resulted in the division of Christianity into the Roman Catholic and Eastern Orthodox churches."
fiction: -  "The Great Schism of 1054 resulted in the division of Christianity into the Jedi and Sith churches."

truth: -  "The Hanseatic League was a commercial and defensive confederation of merchant guilds and market towns in Northwestern and Central Europe."
fiction: -  "The Hanseatic League was a commercial and defensive confederation of wizard guilds and magical towns in Northwestern and Central Europe."

truth: -  "The Reconquista was a period in the history of the Iberian Peninsula, from the 8th to the 15th century, during which Christian kingdoms reconquered territory taken by the Moors."
fiction: -  "The Reconquista was a period in the history of the Iberian Peninsula, from the 8th to the 15th century, during which Christian kingdoms reconquered territory taken by the dragons."

truth: -  "The Domesday Book was a record of a survey of the lands of England made by order of William the Conqueror in 1086."
fiction: -  "The Domesday Book was a record of a survey of the lands of England made by order of William the Conqueror in 1086, documenting the locations of unicorn herds."

truth: -  "The medieval period saw the rise of universities as centers of learning in Bologna, Paris, and Oxford."
fiction: -  "The medieval period saw the rise of universities as centers of learning in Atlantis, Neverland, and Oz."
